benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01-TC07, TC20, TC21) validate successful retrieval and combinations of query parameters.
Empty Response: TC08 and TC23 cover accounts that have no payment methods (empty-array response).
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for valid and invalid query parameter combinations (withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit values; TC02-TC07, TC12, TC13).
Error Handling: Basic error cases for invalid accountId format and non-existent account are covered (TC09, TC10).
Authentication/Authorization: Missing token case is covered (TC11) and some security input validation tests exist (SQL injection TC17, XSS TC18).
Resiliency/Integration: Service/unavailable and retry/recovery scenarios covered (TC15, TC19, TC22).
Performance/Scale: A large dataset performance/response-time check is present (TC14).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination behavior or verify handling of very large datasets beyond returning "all" items (no page/limit/offset validation).
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No scenarios validate caching headers or semantics (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (304).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits, 429 responses, or behavior under burst requests.
Authorization granularity and permissions: Only a missing-token (401) case exists; no tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based access restrictions.

Response Schema & Field-level Validation: Tests assert presence of PaymentMethod objects but do not validate required fields/types/formats inside each PaymentMethod or content-type header; contract/schema validation is missing.
Edge-case query param types/limits: No tests for extremely long/large pluginProperty values, too many pluginProperty entries, or numeric/boolean type coercion in query parameters.
Cache/Content Negotiation and Headers: No tests verifying Content-Type application/json, charset handling, or Accept header negotiation.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: introduce scenarios for page/limit/offset (or whatever paging contract exists), including boundary pages, page size limits, and server behavior when requesting beyond last page.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers, conditional GET returning 304, and that responses include appropriate caching headers.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to confirm 429 behavior and retry-after headers or throttling responses.
Expand authorization tests: add 403 tests (authenticated but unauthorized), and tests for different client roles if applicable.
Add schema/field-level validation: tests that assert the presence, types, and formats of required PaymentMethod fields and Content-Type header.
Add robustness tests for query param extremes: very long pluginProperty values, many pluginProperty entries, and type coercion/invalid encodings to ensure proper validation responses (400/422).
Add header/negotiation tests: verify Accept header handling, charset handling, and that JSON is always produced when application/json is requested.
